2. Solving equations

Two-step linear equations

Solve for nn:

3=−5n−73=−5n−7
Answer: n=n=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

You must try to get nn on its own with a coefficient of 11. First you must add 77 to both sides of the equation. Then you must divide both sides of the equation by −5−5.

STEP: Solve for nn
[−3 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]

To solve a linear equation, we do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get nn on its own. To do this we must do the opposite of what has been done to nn.

The 77 has been subtracted from the nn, so we must add 77 to both sides of the equation.

33+710=−5n−7=−5n−7+7=−5n3=−5n−73+7=−5n−7+710=−5n

Now we can focus on getting the coefficient of nn to be 11. To get nn on its own with a coefficient of 11, we must do the opposite of what has been done to nn. We must divide both sides of the equation by −5−5.

1010−5−2n=−5n=−5n−5=n=−210=−5n10−5=−5n−5−2=nn=−2
NOTE: You might have tried to solve this equation by first dividing both sides by the coefficient of nn (which is −5−5 in this case). This would give you the correct answer, as long as you remembered to divide −7−7 by −5−5. But, this method can create fractions that are difficult to work with. (It is also easy to forget to divide −7−7 by −5−5!) It is best to first deal with the number, and only divide by the coefficient of nn as the very last step.

Linear equations: variables on both sides

Solve for yy: 10+y=7y10+y=7y

INSTRUCTION: Give your answer as a simplified fraction. Decimal answers will not be marked as correct.
Answer: y=y=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−1 point ⇒ 1 / 2 points left]
Use inverse operations to get all of the yy's on one side of the equation, and the numbers on the other.
STEP: Solve for yy
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

Whenever we are solving equations, we should start by checking if we can simplify each side. For this question, both sides are already simplified, so we can move on. The next step is to get all of the yy 's on one side of the equation, and the numbers on the other side.

We can see that yy is on the same side as the number. To eliminate it, we need to subtract yy from both sides of the equation.

10+y∴10+y−y∴10=7y=7y−y=6y10+y=7y∴10+y−y=7y−y∴10=6y

Now that we have the yy--terms on one side and the numbers on the other, we need to divide both sides by the coefficient of yy.

∴106∴106∴53y=6y6=y=y=53∴106=6y6∴106=y∴53=yy=53

Additive inverse

Solve for xx:

2=x+32=x+3
Answer: x=x=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

Do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get xx on its own.

STEP: <no title>
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

To solve a linear equation, we do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get the variable on its own.

To get xx on its own we must do the opposite of what has been done to xx. The 33 has been added to xx, so we must subtract 33 from both sides of the equation.

2∴2−3∴−1∴x=x+3=x+3−3=x=−12=x+3∴2−3=x+3−3∴−1=x∴x=−1
NOTE: "Doing the same thing to both sides" to get xx on its own is also called "applying the inverse operation."

Linear equations: simplify first

Solve for pp:

−3−3=−7+p+5p−3−3=−7+p+5p
INSTRUCTION: Give your answer as a simplified fraction.
Answer:

p=p=

fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

Do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get pp on its own.

STEP: Collect the like terms
[−1 point ⇒ 2 / 3 points left]

We need to simplify each side of the equation before trying to solve the equation. We can look at each side of the equation separately to see if we can add any like terms.

−3−3∴−6=−7+p+5p=−7+6p−3−3=−7+p+5p∴−6=−7+6p
STEP: Solve the equation
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]

Now the equation should look familiar, and we are going to do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get pp on its own.

We want to get rid of the −7−7 on the same side as pp. To do this we must add 77 to both sides.

−6+7∴1=−7+6p+7=6p−6+7=−7+6p+7∴1=6p

The last step is to divide by the coefficient of pp on both sides:

∴1616∴p=6p6=p=16∴16=6p616=p∴p=16

Equations with fractions

−7=4a3+6−7=4a3+6
INSTRUCTION: Give your answer as a simplified fraction. Decimal answers will not be marked as correct.
Answer: a=a=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

First subtract 66 from both sides of the equation. Then multiply both sides of the equation by the reciprocal of 4343.

STEP: Solve for aa using inverse operations
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

To solve a linear equation, we do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get aa on its own. The 66 has been added to the aa-term. So, we must subtract 66 from both sides of the equation.

−7∴−7−6∴−13=4a3+6=4a3+6−6=4a3−7=4a3+6∴−7−6=4a3+6−6∴−13=4a3

Now we need to get the coefficient of aa to be 11. So we need to think about what number to multiply 4343 by, to get it to 11. To get rid of the denominator, we need to multiply by 33. In the next step we will divide by 44 to get rid of the numerator.

−13∴3×(−13)∴−39∴−394∴−394∴a=4a3=3×4a3=4a=4a4=a=−394−13=4a3∴3×(−13)=3×4a3∴−39=4a∴−394=4a4∴−394=a∴a=−394

Linear equations: order of operations

Solve for pp:

−5−(−2p+2)=1−5−(−2p+2)=1
Answer:

p=p=

fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

Simplify each side of the equation. Then solve for pp.

STEP: Simplify the left hand side
[−1 point ⇒ 2 / 3 points left]

To simplify any expression, we must first separate it into terms. Then, we simplify each term. Finally, we collect like terms.

NOTE: Terms are separated by ++ and −− and joined by ×× and ÷÷. Separating expressions into terms will make sure that we do the operations in the right order.
−5−(−2p+2)=1−5−(−2p+2)=1

There are two terms on the left hand side of the equation: −5−5 and −(−2p+2)−(−2p+2). We must first simplify −(−2p+2)−(−2p+2) by distributing in the −1−1:

−5+2p−2∴2p−7=1=1−5+2p−2=1∴2p−7=1
STEP: Solve the equation with inverse operations
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]
2p−7∴2p−7+7∴2p∴2p2∴p=1=1+7=8=82=42p−7=1∴2p−7+7=1+7∴2p=8∴2p2=82∴p=4

Setup the equation

The balance scale below is balanced. That means it has the same weight on both sides.
In the answer box below type the whole equation represented by this balanced scale.

Answer: The equation is: .
equation
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

From the picture you need to identify what goes on each side of the equation. Then write the equation with an equal sign between the two sides.

STEP: Solution
[−1 point ⇒ 1 / 2 points left]

This scale is in balance, so the right side is equal to the left side. So something = something else.

STEP: Balance scale
[−1 point ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

An equation in mathematics can be compared to a balance scale. The fulcrum in a balance scale is at the exact center of the bar. In mathematics this can be compared to the equal sign. Everything on the left side of the equal sign must be equal to everything on the right side of the equation just like a balance scale.

Your equation should look like this: i=1i=1.

Multiplicative inverse

Solve for nn:

12=−3n12=−3n
Answer: n=n=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

Do the same thing to both sides of the equation so that the coefficient of nn is 11.

STEP: Solve for nn
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

We want the coefficient of nn to be 11. We have −3n−3n, which means that nn is being multiplied by −3−3. To get nn on its own with a coefficient of 11, we must do the opposite of what has been done to nn; we must divide by −3−3. Whenever we solve equations, we must do the same thing to both sides to make sure that the value of the equation remains the same. So, we must divide both sides of the equation by −3−3.

1212−3−4n=−3n=−3n−3=n=−412=−3n12−3=−3n−3−4=nn=−4
NOTE: 1n1n means the same thing as nn (because when you multiply any number by 11, you get the same number). We usually write nn instead of 1n1n because it is easier, and Mathematicians like things to be as easy as possible.

Multiplicative inverse

3=b73=b7
Answer: b=b=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

Multiply both sides of the equation by 77 to get rid of the fraction.

STEP: Solve for bb
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

We want to get bb on its own. To get bb on its own, we must do the opposite of what has been done to bb. In this question bb has been divided by 77, so we must multiply by 77. Whenever we solve equations, we must do the same thing to both sides to make sure that the value of the equation remains the same. So, we must multiply both sides of the equation by 77.

33×721b=b7=b7×7=b=213=b73×7=b7×721=bb=21
NOTE: "Getting bb on its own" is called isolating bb.

Mystery value

Find the mystery value MM.

Round your answer to 2 decimal places where necessary.

Answer:
numeric
STEP: Solution
[−1 point ⇒ 1 / 2 points left]

This scale is in balance so the right side is equal to the left side. So something = something else.

STEP: Balance scale
[−1 point ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

An equation in mathematics can be compared to a balance scale. Everything on the left side of the equal sign should be equal to everything on the right side of the equation.
You can read the equation like this:

95 ×× "something" will equal 41.

Mathematically we can express this as:

Left sideM×95M×95(÷95)M=Right side=41=41(÷95)What you do on the one sideyou do on the other side.=0,43Left side=Right sideM×95=41M×95(÷95)=41(÷95)you do on the other side.What you do on the one sideM=0,43
0,43×95=41.0,43×95=41.

Therefore the equation is in balance. The left side is equal to the right side.

The distribution law and equations

Solve for aa:

−(−2−2a)=1−(−2−2a)=1
INSTRUCTION: Give your answer as a simplified fraction. Decimal answers will not be marked as correct.
Answer: a=a=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

The first thing you should do is distribute the −1−1 into the binomial (−2−2a)(−2−2a). After that, continue to solve the equation.

STEP: Simplify the left hand side of the equation
[−1 point ⇒ 2 / 3 points left]

The first thing that we do when solving equations is simplify each side of the equation. We can use the distributive law to simplify the left hand side of this equation. The right hand side is already simplified, so we will leave it as is for now.

−(−2−2a)−1×(−2)−1×(−2a)2+2a=1=1=1−(−2−2a)=1−1×(−2)−1×(−2a)=12+2a=1
STEP: Use inverses to solve for aa
[−2 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]

Now we can solve the equation using inverse operations to isolate aa.

2+2a2+2a−22a2a2a=1=1−2=−1=−12=−122+2a=12+2a−2=1−22a=−12a2=−12a=−12
NOTE: You could have also solved this equation by first dividing both sides by −1−1.

Equations with fractions: 1-step

Solve for xx:

5=52x5=52x
Answer: x=x=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 1 / 1 points left]

Multiply by the reciprocal to get rid of the fraction.

STEP: Multiply by the reciprocal
[−1 point ⇒ 0 / 1 points left]

To get xx on its own, we need to get the coefficient of xx to be 11. So we need to think about what number to multiply 5252 by, to get it to 11. To get rid of the denominator, we need to multiply by 22. To get rid of the numerator, we need to divide by 55.

This is the same as multiplying by 2525. This number is called the reciprocal of 5252. We must do this on both sides of the equation.

551×252∴x=52x=25×52x=x=25=52x51×25=25×52x2=x∴x=2
NOTE: You could also have done this in two steps. You could multiply both sides by the denominator first, and then divide both sides by the numerator.

Two-step linear equations

Solve for mm:

−3m+3=1−3m+3=1
INSTRUCTION: Give you answer as a simplified fraction. Decimal answers will not be marked as correct.
Answer: m=m=
fraction
HINT: <no title>
[−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

You must try to get mm on its own with a coefficient of 11. First you must subtract 33 from both sides of the equation. Then you must divide both sides of the equation by −3−3.

STEP: Solve for mm
[−3 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]

To solve a linear equation, we do the same thing to both sides of the equation to get mm on its own. To do this we must do the opposite of what has been done to mm.

The 33 has been added to the mm, so we must subtract 33 from both sides of the equation.

−3m+3−3m+3−3−3m=1=1−3=−2−3m+3=1−3m+3−3=1−3−3m=−2

Now we can focus on getting the coefficient of mm to be 11. To get mm on its own with a coefficient of 11, we must do the opposite of what has been done to mm. We must divide both sides of the equation by −3−3.

−3m−3m−3m=−2=−2−3=23−3m=−2−3m−3=−2−3m=23
NOTE: You might have tried to solve this equation by first dividing both sides by the coefficient of mm (which is −3−3 in this case). This would give you the correct answer, as long as you remembered to divide 33 by −3−3. But, this method can create fractions that are difficult to work with. (It is also easy to forget to divide 33 by −3−3!) It is best to first deal with the number, and only divide by the coefficient of mm as the very last step.

fraction
